title: Street Headshot Photography with Peter Hurley and Fujifilm X100S
summary: Renowned headshot photographer Peter Hurley takes to the Las Vegas strip to demonstrate how to capture professional-quality headshots in a chaotic street environment using the Fujifilm X100S and a mobile lighting setup.

steps.action: Introduce the primary camera used for the shoot.
Set up a mobile studio on the street using assistants to hold lighting and a background.
Photograph the first subject against the white board while directing their pose.
Review the captured images on the camera's LCD screen.
Continue the session with various subjects, utilizing the portable lights to illuminate them in the night setting.
Conclude the street session after successfully capturing multiple headshots.

key_takeaways: Professional headshots can be achieved in public spaces with a portable background and lighting setup.
The Fujifilm X100S is a capable tool for professional portraiture even in low-light street conditions.
Directing subjects and managing lighting are crucial for high-quality results in uncontrolled environments.
